org.kawanfw.file.api.client

Class FileSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kawanfw.file.api.client.FileSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Deprecated. 
    As of version 3.0, replaced by:
    • RemoteSession for session establishment and simple file upload & download.
    • RemoteFile for operations on remote files.

    public class FileSession
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    Main class - before version 3.0 - for executing from a client (Windows, OX S, Linux/Unix and Android) all sorts of operations on remote files or remote classes through an Http or Https session.

    Class includes methods to:

    • Get remote files size.
    • Delete remote files or directories.
    • TestReload if a remote file or directory exists.
    • Rename remote files.
    • Create remote directories.
    • Get the list of files of a remote directory.
    • Get the list of sub-directories of a remote directory.
    • Upload files by wrapping bytes copy from a FileInputStream to a RemoteOutputStream.
    • Download files by wrapping bytes copy from a RemoteInputStream to a FileOtputStream.
    • Call remote Java methods.

    Example: 

     // Define URL of the path to the ServerFileManager servlet
 String url = "https://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager";
 
 // The login info for strong authentication on server side:
 String username = "myUsername";
 char[] password = { 'm', 'y', 'P', 'a', 's', 's', 'w', 'o', 'r', 'd' };
 
 // Establish a session with the remote server
 FileSession fileSession = new FileSession(url, username, password);
 
 // OK: upload a file
 fileSession.upload(new File("c:\\myFile.txt"), "/home/mylogin/myFile.txt");

    Communication via an (authenticating) proxy server is done using a HttpProxy instance: 

     HttpProxy httpProxy = new HttpProxy("myproxyhost", 8080);
 String url = "https://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager";
 
 // The login info for strong authentication on server side:
 String username = "myUsername";
 char[] password = { 'm', 'y', 'P', 'a', 's', 's', 'w', 'o', 'r', 'd' };
 
 FileSession fileSession = new FileSession(url, username, password, httpProxy);
 
 // Etc.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nicolas de Pomereu
    See Also:
    HttpProxy, RemoteSession, RemoteFile, RemoteInputStream, RemoteOutputStream

      • FileSession

        public FileSession(String url,
           String username,
           char[] password,
           HttpProxy httpProxy,
           HttpProtocolParameters httpProtocolParameters)
            throws MalformedURLException,
                   UnknownHostException,
                   ConnectException,
                   SocketException,
                   InvalidLoginException,
                   RemoteException,
                   SecurityException,
                   IOException
        Deprecated. As of version 3.0, replaced by: RemoteSession.RemoteSession(String, String, char[])
        Creates an Awake FILE session with a proxy and protocol parameters.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the path to the ServerFileManager Servlet
        username - the username for authentication on the Awake Server (may be null for call()
        password - the user password for authentication on the Awake Server (may be null)
        httpProxy - the http proxy to use (null if none)
        httpProtocolParameters - the http parameters to use (may be null)
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - if the url is malformed
        UnknownHostException - if Host URL (http://www.acme.org) does not exists or no Internet Connection.
        ConnectException - if the Host is correct but the ServerFileManager Servlet is not reachable (http://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager) and access failed with a status != OK (200). (If the host is incorrect, or is impossible to connect to - Tomcat down - the ConnectException will be the sub exception HttpHostConnectException.)
        SocketException - if network failure during transmission
        InvalidLoginException - the username or password is invalid
        SecurityException - Scheme is required to be https (SSL/TLS)
        RemoteException - an exception has been thrown on the server side. This traps an Awake product failure and should not happen.
        IOException - for all other IO / Network / System Error

      • download

        public void download(String remoteFile,
            File file)
              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                     InvalidLoginException,
                     FileNotFoundException,
                     UnknownHostException,
                     ConnectException,
                     SocketException,
                     RemoteException,
                     IOException
        Deprecated. As of version 3.0, replaced by: RemoteSession.download(String, File)
        Downloads a file from the remote server.
        This method simply wraps bytes copy from a RemoteInputStream to a FileOutputStream.

        The real path of the remote file depends on the Awake FILE configuration on the server. See User Documentation.

        Large files are split in chunks that are downloaded in sequence. The default chunk length is 10Mb. You can change the default value with HttpProtocolParameters.setDownloadChunkLength(long) before passing HttpProtocolParameters to this class constructor.

        Note that file chunking requires that all chunks be downloaded from to the same web server. Thus, file chunking does not support true stateless architecture with multiple identical web servers. If you want to set a full stateless architecture with multiple identical web servers, you must disable file chunking. This is done by setting a 0 download chunk length value using HttpProtocolParameters.setDownloadChunkLength(long).

        A recovery mechanism allows - in case of failure - to start again in the same JVM run the file download from the last non-downloaded chunk. See User Guide for more information.

        Note that this method can not be used with a progress indicator/monitor and so does not implement any increment mechanism. The reason is dual:

        • Implementing an increment mechanism would require to add cumbersome API.
        • Wrapped classes RemoteInputStream and FileOutputStream allow easy implementation of progress indicators. See Tutorial & included examples.
        Parameters:
        remoteFile - the file name - path included - on the host
        file - the file to create on the client side
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if remoteFile or file is null
        InvalidLoginException - the session has been closed by a logoff()
        FileNotFoundException - if the remote file is not found on server
        UnknownHostException - if Host URL (http://www.acme.org) does not exists or no Internet Connection.
        ConnectException - if the Host is correct but the ServerFileManager Servlet is not reachable (http://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager) and access failed with a status != OK (200). (If the host is incorrect, or is impossible to connect to - Tomcat down - the ConnectException will be the sub exception HttpHostConnectException.)
        SocketException - if network failure during transmission
        RemoteException - an exception has been thrown on the server side
        IOException - for all other IO / Network / System Error

      • upload

        public void upload(File file,
          String remoteFile)
            throws IllegalArgumentException,
                   InvalidLoginException,
                   FileNotFoundException,
                   UnknownHostException,
                   ConnectException,
                   SocketException,
                   RemoteException,
                   IOException
        Deprecated. As of version 3.0, replaced by: RemoteSession.upload(File, String)
        Uploads a file on the server.
        This method simply wraps bytes copy from a FileInputStream to a RemoteOutputStream.

        The real path of the remote file depends on the Awake FILE configuration on the server. See User Documentation.

        Large files are split in chunks that are uploaded in sequence. The default chunk length is 3Mb. You can change the default value with HttpProtocolParameters.setUploadChunkLength(long) before passing HttpProtocolParameters to this class constructor.

        Note that file chunking requires all chunks to be sent to the same web server that will aggregate the chunks after the last send. Thus, file chunking does not support true stateless architecture with multiple identical web servers. If you want to set a full stateless architecture with multiple identical web servers, you must disable file chunking. This is done by setting a 0 upload chunk length value using HttpProtocolParameters.setUploadChunkLength(long).

        A recovery mechanism allows - in case of failure - to start again in the same JVM run the file upload from the last non-uploaded chunk. See User Guide for more information.

        Note that this method can not be used with a progress indicator/monitor and so does not implement any increment mechanism. The reason is dual:

        • Implementing an increment mechanism would require to add cumbersome API.
        • Wrapped classes FileInputStream and RemoteOutputStream allow easy implementation of progress indicators. See Tutorial & included examples.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to upload
        remoteFile - the file name - path included - on the host
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if file or remoteFile is null
        InvalidLoginException - the session has been closed by a logoff()
        FileNotFoundException - if the file to upload is not found
        UnknownHostException - if Host URL (http://www.acme.org) does not exists or no Internet Connection.
        ConnectException - if the Host is correct but the ServerFileManager Servlet is not reachable (http://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager) and access failed with a status != OK (200). (If the host is incorrect, or is impossible to connect to - Tomcat down - the ConnectException will be the sub exception HttpHostConnectException.)
        SocketException - if network failure during transmission
        RemoteException - an exception has been thrown on the server side
        IOException - for all other IO / Network / System Error

      • length

        public long length(List<String> remoteFiles)
            throws IllegalArgumentException,
                   InvalidLoginException,
                   UnknownHostException,
                   ConnectException,
                   SocketException,
                   RemoteException,
                   IOException
        Deprecated. As of version 3.0, replaced by: RemoteSession.length(List)
        Returns the length of a list of files located on the remote host.

        This convenient methods is provided for fast compute of the total length of a list of files to download, without contacting the server for each file result. (Case using a progress monitor).

        The real paths of the remote files depend on the Awake FILE configuration on the server. See User Documentation.

        Parameters:
        remoteFiles - the list of the files - path included - located on the remote host.
        Returns:
        the total length in bytes of the files located on the remote host.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - remoteFiles is null
        InvalidLoginException - the session has been closed by a logoff()
        UnknownHostException - if the host URL (http://www.acme.org) does not exists or no Internet Connection.
        ConnectException - if the Host is correct but the ServerFileManager Servlet is not reachable (http://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager) and access failed with a status != OK (200). (If the host is incorrect, or is impossible to connect to - Tomcat down - the ConnectException will be the sub exception HttpHostConnectException.)
        SocketException - if network failure during transmission
        RemoteException - an exception has been thrown on the server side
        IOException - for all other IO / Network / System Error

      • rename

        public boolean rename(String remotePathname,
             String remotePathnameDest,
             boolean deleteIfExists)
               throws IllegalArgumentException,
                      InvalidLoginException,
                      UnknownHostException,
                      ConnectException,
                      SocketException,
                      RemoteException,
                      IOException
        Deprecated. As of version 3.0, replaced by: RemoteFile.renameTo(RemoteFile)
        Renames a remote pathname.
        (File.renameTo(File) is executed on remote host.)
        The method allows a previous delete of the file corresponding to the destination file name.

        The real path of the remote file depends on the Awake FILE configuration on the server. See User Documentation.

        Parameters:
        remotePathname - A pathname on the host
        remotePathnameDest - The pathname new name
        deleteIfExists - If true, the file or directory scorresponding to remoteFileDest will be deleted if it exists with File.delete() before the rename
        Returns:
        true if and only if the renaming succeeded; false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if remoteFile or remoteFileDest is null
        InvalidLoginException - the session has been closed by a logoff()
        UnknownHostException - if the host URL (http://www.acme.org) does not exists or no Internet Connection.
        ConnectException - if the Host is correct but the ServerFileManager Servlet is not reachable (http://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager) and access failed with a status != OK (200). (If the host is incorrect, or is impossible to connect to - Tomcat down - the ConnectException will be the sub exception HttpHostConnectException.)
        SocketException - if network failure during transmission
        RemoteException - an exception has been thrown on the server side
        IOException - for all other IO / Network / System Error

      • delete

        public boolean delete(String remotePathname)
               throws IllegalArgumentException,
                      InvalidLoginException,
                      UnknownHostException,
                      ConnectException,
                      RemoteException,
                      IOException
        Deprecated. As of version 3.0, replaced by: RemoteFile.delete()
        Deletes a remote file or remote directory on the host. (Directory must be empty to be deleted).
        (File.delete() is executed on remote host.)

        The real path of the remote file depends on the Awake FILE configuration on the server. See User Documentation.

        Parameters:
        remotePathname - A pathname on the host
        Returns:
        true if the remote file or directory has been deleted
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if remotePathname is null
        InvalidLoginException - the session has been closed by a logoff()
        UnknownHostException - if Host URL (http://www.acme.org) does not exists or no Internet Connection.
        ConnectException - if the Host is correct but the ServerFileManager Servlet is not reachable (http://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager) and access failed with a status != OK (200). (If the host is incorrect, or is impossible to connect to - Tomcat down - the ConnectException will be the sub exception HttpHostConnectException.)
        SocketException - if network failure during transmission
        RemoteException - an exception has been thrown on the server side
        SecurityException - the url is not secured with https (SSL)
        IOException - for all other IO / Network / System Error

      • mkdirs

        public boolean mkdirs(String remotePathname)
               throws IllegalArgumentException,
                      InvalidLoginException,
                      UnknownHostException,
                      ConnectException,
                      SocketException,
                      RemoteException,
                      IOException
        Deprecated. As of version 3.0, replaced by: RemoteFile.mkdirs()
        Creates a directory on the remote host, including any necessary but nonexistent parent directories.
        (File.mkdirs() is executed on remote host.)

        The real path of the remote file depends on the Awake FILE configuration on the server. See User Documentation.

        Parameters:
        remotePathname - A pathname on the host
        Returns:
        true if and only if the directory was created, along with all necessary parent directories; false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if remoteFile is null
        InvalidLoginException - the session has been closed by a logoff()
        UnknownHostException - if host url (http://www.acme.org) does not exists or no Internet Connection.
        ConnectException - if the Host is correct but the ServerFileManager Servlet is not reachable (http://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager) and access failed with a status != OK (200). (If the host is incorrect, or is impossible to connect to - Tomcat down - the ConnectException will be the sub exception HttpHostConnectException.)
        SocketException - if network failure during transmission
        IOException - for all other IO / Network / System Error
        RemoteException

      • listFiles

        public List<String> listFiles(String remoteFile)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException,
                              InvalidLoginException,
                              UnknownHostException,
                              ConnectException,
                              SocketException,
                              RemoteException,
                              IOException
        Deprecated. As of version 3.0, replaced by: RemoteFile.listFiles(FileFilter)
        Lists the files contained in a remote directory.
        (Only remote files that return true to File.isFile() are returned.)

        The real path of the remote directory depends on the Awake FILE configuration on the server. See User Documentation.

        Parameters:
        remoteFile - the file name of the directory on the host
        Returns:
        the list of files in the remote directory. Will be null if the remote directory does not exists. Will be empty if the remote directory exists but has no files.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if remoteFile is null
        InvalidLoginException - the session has been closed by a logoff()
        UnknownHostException - if Host URL (http://www.acme.org) does not exists or no Internet Connection.
        ConnectException - if the Host is correct but the ServerFileManager Servlet is not reachable (http://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager) and access failed with a status != OK (200). (If the host is incorrect, or is impossible to connect to - Tomcat down - the ConnectException will be the sub exception HttpHostConnectException.)
        SocketException - if network failure during transmission
        RemoteException - an exception has been thrown on the server side
        IOException - for all other IO / Network / System Error

        public List<String> listDirectories(String remoteFile)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                    InvalidLoginException,
                                    UnknownHostException,
                                    ConnectException,
                                    SocketException,
                                    RemoteException,
                                    IOException
        Deprecated. As of version 3.0, replaced by: RemoteFile.listFiles(FileFilter)
        Lists the sub-directories contained in a remote directory.
        (Only remote files that return true to File.isDirectory() are returned.)

        The real path of the remote directory depends on the Awake FILE configuration on the server. See User Documentation.

        Parameters:
        remoteFile - the file name of the directory on the host
        Returns:
        the list of directories in the remote directory. Will be null if the remote directory does not exists. Will be empty if the remote directory exists but has no sub-directories.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if remoteFile is null
        InvalidLoginException - the session has been closed by a logoff()
        UnknownHostException - if Host URL (http://www.acme.org) does not exists or no Internet Connection.
        ConnectException - if the Host is correct but the ServerFileManager Servlet is not reachable (http://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager) and access failed with a status != OK (200). (If the host is incorrect, or is impossible to connect to - Tomcat down - the ConnectException will be the sub exception HttpHostConnectException.)
        SocketException - if network failure during transmission
        RemoteException - an exception has been thrown on the server side
        IOException - for all other IO / Network / System Error

      • call

        public String call(String methodName,
          Object... params)
            throws IllegalArgumentException,
                   InvalidLoginException,
                   UnknownHostException,
                   ConnectException,
                   SocketException,
                   RemoteException,
                   IOException
        Deprecated. As of version 3.0, replaced by: RemoteSession.call(String, Object...)
        Calls a remote Java method and (eventually) pass some parameters to it.
        Parameters:
        methodName - the full method name to call in the format org.acme.config.package.MyClass.myMethod
        params - the array of parameters passed to the method
        Returns:
        the result of the Java call as String
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if methodName is null
        InvalidLoginException - the session has been closed by a logoff()
        UnknownHostException - if Host URL (http://www.acme.org) does not exists or no Internet Connection.
        ConnectException - if the Host is correct but the ServerFileManager Servlet is not reachable (http://www.acme.org/ServerFileManager) and access failed with a status != OK (200). (If the host is incorrect, or is impossible to connect to - Tomcat down - the ConnectException will be the sub exception HttpHostConnectException.)
        SocketException - if network failure during transmission
        RemoteException - an exception has been thrown on the server side
        IOException - for all other IO / Network / System Error

      • clone

        public FileSession clone()
        Deprecated. 
        Allows to get a copy of the current RemoteSession: use it to do some simultaneous operations in a different thread (in order to avoid conflicts).
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object

      • getVersion

        public String getVersion()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the Awake FILE Version.
        Returns:
        the Awake FILE Version

      • logoff

        public void logoff()
        Deprecated. 
        Logs off from the remote host.  This will purge the authentication values necessary for method calls.

        Method should be called at the closure of the Client application.
